While Quenellian relations with the fey are… amicable, The Castle was built far enough from the border of the woods to prevent the wood elves interference with its walls such as at Castle Quenelles.
Merceaux Descloux

Founded by Shallyan cultists, Merceaux Descloux has grown as those seeking cures for their ailments have begun to settle around the monastery in thanks. These supplicants have built small homes and tilled the land, providing for everything the cultists here need.
At the foot of Massif Orcal, is the hamlet of Montlac. Montlac uses the terraces on the hills around them to grow line after line of grape vines, which are harvested for the tables of Nobles.
Saint Gaudens
Saint Gaudens is along the road that runs between Merceaux Descloux and Castle Quenelles. The people here long ago found a large deposit of clay.
Castle Carrard

Castle Carrad sits on the shore of the River Brienne near the border of Carcassonne and the Forest of Loren. Its lord, Leofric Carrard, has inherited the fief in absentia. His father had given him permission to embark on his Grail Quest but as soon as Leofric left, his father grew gravely ill and passed into the arms of the Lady. Duke Tancred II has taken stewardship here until Leofric returns.

Nice is an old village, so old in fact that some Nobles suspect that the fey originally inhabited it. Despite this suspicion, the Fey have never disturbed the village, at least not in a manner particular compared to the normal demands and restrictions.
Labège
On the river Brienne, Labège sits mostly undisturbed by either invaders or their own lords. The people here are known for their cheese, which is commonly exported out of the Kingdom.
Along the road to Brionne is the village of Grasse, named for the tall grasses that grow in this region of Bretonnia. The people here raise notably large cattle on the grasses.
Castle Laguiller
Castle Laguiller is both a castle and a major river port along the River Brienne. Nearby is the Grave of Cuileux, a Quenellian holy site where the founder of the Dukedom is entered.
On the river Brienne, sits the large farming village of Brusse. It was established by its lord as a plantation to grow flax for the industries in Quenelles.

Montaudran is an isolated community, known only for their cultivation of cotton on the fertile plains north of Castle Laguiller. The village is remarkably close to the Grave of Cuileux, the people here are used to the sight of knights coming and going to pay their respects to the long dead hero.
Borderouge is the last stop on the road before the Quenellian - Brionnian border. There is a tavern in the village, catering to traveling knights and merchants.
Castle Mousillon

In the abyssal, death-ridden swamps formed by the slowing of the River Grismerie, Castle Mousillon slowly descends into the boundless depths of Mousillon’s murky waters. Mousillon itself thrives on barter and trade within the walls itself, many believe even more unsavoury acts happen deep within the city. Laden with dark lit taverns, unsavoury brothels, and dens of thieves, Mousillon is a haven for the enemies of Bretonnia.
Le Marais Mort

Located just north of Mousillon, Les Marais Mort is hidden just beyond a vast number of hills, called Les Collines de Charnel. The village is barebones and infested with peasants afflicted by various mutations, many believe the origin to be long lost diseases emanating from Le Collines de Charnel.

Residing on the northern bank of the Grismerie river, the small settlement of Gorges houses many humans and mutants alike. Being even poorer than most Bretonnian settlements, Gorges stays afloat with communal fishing and what little they can scratch out of the ground. When they aren’t levied into their lord's armies.

La Grange, nicknamed “The Barn”, houses many steeds who would dare to graze into the foetid swamps of Mousillon. Although a breeding ground for livestock, it is also popular for mutants and humans that need safe dwelling from the foul creatures of the night.
Castle Rachard

Across the border of Lyonesse, Castle Rachard is lorded over by none other than Lord Rachard himself. Surprisingly, these lands are fairly established and well kept considering Mousillon’s hellish landscape and numerous dangers. Some adventurers and villagers say they hear noises coming from the castle, however no one has ever investigated the ongoing activities within the castle.
Le Rosier Noir

Not so much a village but more of a Tavern surrounded by makeshift homes, Le Rosier Noir is a small gathering hub for many unwanted vagrants and shifty wanderers. Indeed it is remarkable the small village houses mostly humans and not any mutants. The few houses surrounding the village are home to the manystaff at Le Rosier Noir.
Castle Hane

A small hamlet that is isolated from most of Mousillon itself, Yremy is home to a great number of humans, rather than mutants. Many of the peasants residing in the village work for Lord Aucassin and work in his kitchen at Chateau Hane. Yremy does get some trade because of its closeness to Grenouille Gate however.
Blood Keep

Once the home of a valiant order of Knights known as the Order of the Blood Dragon, or the Ordo Draconis. One fateful night, a Vampire known as Walach Harkon challenged every Knight to single combat, eventually turning all who he deemed worthy into Vampires. The entirety of the Ordo Draconis was then wiped from existence and became known as the Blood Dragons.
